metadata.title: CVE-2023-35956 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: Multiple heap-based buffer overflow vulnerabilities exist in thefstReaderIterBlocks2 VCDATA parsing functionality of GTKWave 3.3.115. Aspecially-crafted .fst file can lead to arbitrary code execution. A victimwould need to open a malicious file to trigger these vulnerabilities.Thisvulnerability concerns the decompression function `fastlz_decompress`.

criterions.comment: gtkwave: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
